title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: The same appearances are beheld to the north-east, while on the south and south-east are seen, at a few miles' distance,  the slopes of the Cathkin Braes, adorned with plantations and gentlemen's seats, amongst which may be distinguished Castlemilk, where Mary Queen of Scots is said, and with probability,  to have lodged on the night previous to the battle of Langside.
